question: Do you support the government having the authority to enforce vaccination and quarantine measures during severe epidemics? Please answer briefly in 1–2 sentences.

comments.comment: I do not. I think that people can be highly encouraged but I do not think they should enforce them as some people have different beliefs.
no because people still going do what they want do so no point.
I support quarantine and vaccination enforcement because it is the best way to ensure public health and prevent the spread of disease.
yes, having just went through a pandemic, not being vacinatted really affected everything.  It slowed down how were able to live our lives.
i support the government because that is the best way to prevent pandemics from spreading

Yes, i believe that if vaccination have been tested and proven to help protect people from illness, then it’s important to enforce vaccination measures so people will be protected and can help reduce the spreading of disease.
Yes, I think especially early in the pandemic, it was important to be able to enforce these things as not enough was known about the virus. But as more was known, it was ok to remove the measures.

I think it's a good idea because sometimes people just make bad decisions for themselves and put everyone else at risk because of it, and so sometimes we should step in and tell them what to do for the greater good.
Yes,  it's important for people to be vaccinated. Opposing this could lead to wide spread disease.
No I don’t support mandated vaccines. The vaccines made for covid when it first happened were not studied or sampled for long at all. Many people developed autoimmune issues.

As much as it infringes somewhat on individual rights, vaccination during severe epidemics can be a matter of national survival. Hence, I support vaccination and quarantine, but only under the proviso that the epidemic is truly severe and that the vaccines developed are truly effective.
No i do not support the government to enforce vaccines on people, people should make their own choices on what to put in their body. Quarantine is fine if it’s really bad.
Yes. It's important for herd immunity. People should be forced to do quarantine and get vaccinated for the good of the community.
Yes, from a science point of view, it is important for the public. While others may feel it should be a choice, the government needs to properly sensitize the public on how severe a disease is.
No, I don't support the government with that power. Using covid as our baseline they did a fairly poor job.
I support governments being able to enforce vaccination and quarantine measures to stop epidemics. This is for the greater good of the nation and only has the best intentions for the public.
I think I do not there’s too much conflicted data and research that these policies only scare the public.

No, I do NOT support the government having the power to FORCE people to get vaccinated. The reason for this is that vaccination is a health issue, and there's no guarantee that the vaccine will even be safe, like what happened during the coronavirus pandemic where we had to get vaccinated or we'd lose certain freedoms, and the vaccine wasn't even safe because of all the side effects that people who took it suffered from or even died from.

I think that the government can and should enforce quarantine measures in response to a severe epidemic.  However, I don't think that they should force vaccinations upon people.  The vaccine was likely developed in response to the epidemic and doesn't have the longitudinal data to support making individuals receive it.

I think the government should have the authority to enforce vaccine and quarantine measures. Those who don't follow these mandatory guidelines will be criminally penalized, prohibited from work, or marked unvaccinated as a warning and to prepare others from catching the virus. It sounds harsh, but if this severe epidemic caused the death of thousands or millions of people in a short time, like COVID, the government must look out for its people.

I do support the government having the authority to enforce vaccination and quarantine measures as long as it is in the best interests of citizens' health, and for no other reason. This could be the most effective route to positive outcome.

I support these measures. By preventing mass infection and death through providing easily accessible solutions, people firmly defying that should be held accountable for their role in counterproductive action for mass health.
I do not support the governments authority over vaccinations during severe epidemics.
No, I do not think anyone should be forced to get a vaccination. It is our own body.
Yes, I support it. In severe epidemics, government authority to enforce vaccination and quarantine is important to protect public health and prevent widespread harm.
I only support if the vaccination will be optional. The government shouldn't require or force anyone to take a vaccine.

I do support the government enforcing vaccines and quarantine during severe epidemics because of what happened during covid. I think some people are too stupid and they need to be told to do something so they don't die or risk other people because of their carelessness.

Yes, I fully support the government having that authority during severe epidemics because their ultimate goal is to keep people safe and healthy. It may not be the most enjoyable situation to be in, but we have a right as citizens to ensure our safety in times of crisis as a collective.
I do not. Why? Because the US government is not a dictatorship, it has no authority to "enforce" these measures even during epidemics.
No, this is because the government ides critical information from the masses which makes them not to be trustworthy.
yes of course lest we would be sand by now we need authorities in our lives
I fully support the government enforcing vaccination and quarantine measures. I think this ensures everyone's safety at the end of the day.
No I do not, this is a form of stupid evil satanic and worthless Marxist communist doctrine.

Yes, because in severe epidemics, it is important to have sufficient coverage of immunity across the general population to mitigate spread. The government is there to support the greater good of the populace, and I think this falls under that responsibility.

I think it’s really important for the government to have the power to require vaccinations and quarantine when there’s a serious outbreak. It helps keep everyone safe and stops the disease from spreading too much.

I support the government having the authority to enforce vaccination and quarantine measures because the faster people get immunized and protected, the faster the epidemic will end. The vaccination and quarantine measures only get more effective the more people follow instructions, therefore it is important that people know what they should do.
Yes I think it's important if they believe it is truely and emergency situation to be able to require vaccines and/or quarantine
I do not support government enforcing vaccination and quarantine measures during severe epidemics. I think the government should make vaccines available, but not mandatory.
I think the government should have the power to enforce quarantine measures because it keeps people safe during the pandemics, and vaccinations help protect people from getting sick.

I support the government having the authority to enforce vaccination and quarantine measures during severe epidemics because it is for the common good and helps protect everyone’s health. Having these measures in place help stop the spread of diseases and quickly save lives.
Yes, I do, because it is a choice that can prevent suffering and saving other peoples' lives.

No. The government has lost credibility in its handling of epidemic outbreaks and rightfully so. That is not to say that I believe there was a mass conspiracy, but rather officials who claimed to definitively know, with absolute certainty, the best course of action when they did not.
Quarantine in some scenarios. Required vaccination, absolutely not.

Yes, I support the government having authority to require vaccines and quarantines especially during severe epidemics. Vaccines are safe and proven science and are needed to protect society and the most vulnerable.
Yes, it is important to protect the safety and health of all individuals, if enforcing these kind of measures can achieve that, then yes it should be implemented.

When there's a bad sickness, the government should have power to make people get shots. They should also be able to tell sick people to stay home, it might not be something everyone likes but for the greater good it is sometimes necessary.

While I support the government enforcing quarantine measures during severe epidemics, I feel it is wrong to force a quickly produced and limitedly tested vaccine on people, as happened during the covid epidemic.

As long as the government is funding these vaccinations and these vaccinations are actually doing what they are supposed to be, I see no reason why it shouldn't be enforceable. I suppose this so long as the funding does not require the person getting it to pay for it, otherwise this becomes a wealth disparity situation as well where you're punished for not being able to afford the vaccination.
Yes i do absolutely support governments authority , its an necessary measure that has to be implemented to protect the public health from severe epidemics and wide spread death .
Yes, I do as it can save lives and prevent outbreaks

I do support quarantine and vaccination measures if safe for individuals to protect public. These measures ensures continuation of safe services, school, and work while limiting illness and death during epidemics strong period.

No, the government should not be able to enforce anything on the people because they can abuse this. If one thing is being enforced, then another area can be as well. There is nothing wrong with enforcing through media and commercials, ad's ... but people should have free will regarding this. *And maybe they should stop cooking up sicknesses in the lab so people wont need to go through these things* ;)

Vaccination, no, quarantine, yes. The people who do not accept the vaccination should not get the same understanding unless medically proven otherwise. If they do not get it, I think they should be willing to stay home or accept the consequences, and if someone falls ill due to their poor decisions, they should be fined. Ultimately, I think it should be a case-by-case basis, but the majority of people I think should be made to receive the vaccine.
Yes, I do because I have family members who are immune compromised and they deserve the right to exist outside of their homes without getting sick and dying because of a severe epidemic.

Vaccinations-No, We should be able to decide what we put in our bodies as personal, individual decisions without government interference. Quarantine-No, Again the government should not interfere with our lives If we are not breaking any laws, but people should have the decency and compassion for others to quarantine themselves if they're sick.

I do not support enforced vaccination.  This should be a privilege and right that each individual has to determine what goes in their body.  Enforcing quarantine measures is different as it affects other individuals who do not have the right to tell others to not infect them.

The government should regulate vaccination during severe epidemics. They should supervise the validity/ingredients of the vaccine, and it should be FDA approved first. The vaccine should be safe for everyone, and of course, quarantine policies should be put in place immediately after the epidemic has been determined. As a precaution, the public should be aware of everything.
Short answer is no in the US. That tramples the constitution and is tyrannical.
i do not support government having any authority to enforce any kind of vaccination. This is our bodies and our choice to put anything into it. Quarantine measures if warranted are a different story.
Yes,I think they should be able to.This would protect the masses.Maybe it is uncomfortable ,but sometimes it may be necessary .I hate that keeping us safe became a political issue,Crazy.

I don't support the government enforcing vaccinations because I don't trust the government and the vaccinations sometimes cause other issues with your health. I support quarantine measures if it's an epidemic where people are dying and they don't know the cause.

Yes I do.  Since people tend to act selfishly, it is the responsibility of the government to step in and enforce quarantine measures.  I'm less fond of mandatory vaccines...there may be reasons why a person won't take a vaccine.

I do not support the government having authority to enforce vaccination and quarantine measures during severe epidemics. People should have the choice when it comes to their health, bodies and whether or not to get vaccinated.

Yes, the government, based on the feedback and evidence provided by proven scientists and health professionals, should be able to mandate vaccinations and quarantines to safeguard the health of the public at large. That is the role of the government agencies.

I do support this because this will allow people to be safe when serious epidemics or sickness come to the public. It serves as a protection for the people; it won't fully protect us but the chances of getting that disease or sickness is significantly lower.
no absolutely not. they do not have the right to inject my own body with what they think will solve the issue.
No, the government should not mandate that people have vaccinations. It should be the choice of the person.

I do not support the government having the authority to enforce vaccination during severe epidemics. I am a federal worker and I had to get vaccinated or I would lose my job. Now, I have to worry about any after effects I may have years from now. I believe in quarantine measures but not forceable vaccinations.

I support the government in having the authority to enforce vaccine and quarantine measures because we've seen from the last pandemic that the American people are unable to help themselves. Sometimes there needs to be someone to step in and help society as a whole to get through hard times.

I believe people should have a say in the matter of vaccinations. People losing their jobs over a vaccine that they could be potentially allergic to/have a bad reaction to. The government should clear what it is those vaccines so people don't get scared to take something they know nothing about.

I do support it, only in the case of sever epidemics because seeing first hand how many people didn't get vaccinated during COVID, caused COVID to spread even more and caused many unneeded deaths as well as people that were sick and didn't quarantine themselves. I believe people should look out for their fellow citizen, so the government should enforce it, for the greater good of other citizens.

I don't think people should be forced to vaccinate. During the pandemic, some folks lost their jobs because they didn't get vaccinated. Many people who got vaccinated got COVID anyway and transmitted the virus to others. Dems say, "My body, my choice" regarding abortion, but that argument isn't acceptable regarding vaccines.

I do support it. While I sympathize with those who want to maintain bodily autonomy, as I've grown older (and even during the beginning of the pandemic 5 years ago) I recognize that there are certain things that we must do as citizens to maintain a certain social good. and Part of that includes vaccinations and/or quarantine measures to ensure those more vulnerable among us don't get sick and in order to help curtail the contagion. Stop the spread!

Yes. I do support the government having ultimate say in health matters when millions of people are at risk. Quarantine's are a must for suppressing the spread of disease and vaccination is the only real way we can fight against them.

Yes, I support it because we cannot trust all of the public to make sensible decisions that keeps the majority of us safe. There are many citizens who need protection, especially children, the elderly, and the immune compromised. It is unfortunate that it takes government policy to enforce these things to do our best to reduce the harm and death toll caused by an epidemic.

I think its important to enforce some kind of policy to make sure everyone is safe and to ensure no more sickness is passed on, but its also important for people to know that it is a choice and its to keep people safe its not mandatory
Yes I believe so during severe epidemics because it is for the public safety and health.  I do support this, as it should be done regardless.

Yes. I think that government should enforce vaccination where people are dying due to the epidemic. But that policy should be counter measured by freedom of movement. In other words, we vaccinate so that kids can go to school, people can go about their regular lives.
Yes. We need to sacrifice personal liberties in order to protect the greater good of public health.

Quarantine measures make sense to me to contain it but enforcing vaccinations doesn’t need to be required. Places can always set rules on who can enter a place based on vaccination status. It should be up to the person what they get put in their body.

Yes, I do support this for the greater good. I think strong mandates are needed to prevent further spread and to prevent the creation of a pandemic. It might be restrictive, but these temporary measures are necessary to prevent suffering.

I do support the government having this authority only under severe epidemics. People will always be suspicious and the last pandemic showed us that people will fight a vaccine to their detriment. The virus can spread and kill people. It is important that it is handled in the correct way.
No. Although i do agree that people should get a vaccine / get quarentined in these sitiations its not fair to force it on to someone.

Yes, I support vaccine mandates for the good of the public. I will explain why. If there were another virus like the one that causes smallpox or polio, something so devastating like that should not be left in the hands of dumb people who make up vaccine danger conspiracy theories. Vaccines save lives, period. Quarantine also helps to prevent the spread.

No, I do not support the government having authority to enforce vaccination and quarantine measures during severe epidemics. I do not feel like anyone can force a person to inject something into their bodies without their consent at all.
yes vaccinnes should be mandated for everyone to prevent disease
No, I do not because that is oppressive to people. The government does control people like they think they do.
Yes it just shows that people care and want the best for successful outcomes.

Yes.  In times of crisis, collective action becomes critical.  Collective action is almost always impossible when there are a lot of individuals.  One of the functions of the government is precisely to enact collective action.
Yes, enforcing vaccination and quarantine measures during severe epidemics should be necessary. It is important for ensuring the health of the public.
Yes, I believe this will ensure the greater good and protect people from mass death and disease. Even though some freedoms would be restricted temporarily, its the overall correct thing to do.

I dont support government mandates even though I think ignoring the encouragement of professionals is dangerous and selfish. I do support businesses requiring their employees from obtaining vaccination to be eligible to work.
I do not but I understand what they are getting at. I am not sure what the answer is, I guess that if we do not want to vaccinate we must stay out of public?
No and I did not take it, it should be the individuals choice.

I support the government having authority to enforce vaccination and quarantine measures because they need to look for the health of their citizens. However, alternative options need to be put in place for those that cannot get vaccinated.
Yes because vaccines have proven to get rid of diseases. The resurface of old diseases proves vaccines work and when not utilized these diseases continue to resurface.
It is a typical example of government over-reach. Mandating vaccination is violation of human rights. My body my choice - it is that simple.
I do. I am not happy about it but public health comes first with quarantine. However I do not feel the same way about vaccines. I think that should be a personal choice
